thread.title: Protesters attack alleged drug dens in Rosettenville - Times LIVE
thread.title_full: Protesters attack alleged drug dens in Rosettenville - Times LIVE

author: Tmg Digital
title: Protesters attack alleged drug dens in Rosettenville - Times LIVE
text:
Police spokesman Captain Mavela Masondo said that no injuries had been reported but that protesting community members had set fire to furniture from the homes. 
He added that no arrests had been made and that police were investigating the protest. 
No further details were immediately available. 
IRS Investigations @FraudWatchZA tweeted: — IRS Investigations (@FraudWatchZA) February 5, 2017 
REZA @crimeairnetwork tweeted: “Rosettenville burns: protests hit streets.” 
This was followed by: “UPDATE: Rosettenville riots. Residents up in arms ABT decay of environment due to drugs‚ prostitution & crime havens.” Riots in and around rosettenville area pic.twitter.com/OhhboNV3ty — Kevin Clack (@jonnieblack) February 5, 2017 
A tweet from media personality and anti-crime activist Yusuf Abramjee @Abramjee read: Rosettenville Protest: drug dealers apparently been targeted. pic.twitter.com/yFpjS3H0zG — Yusuf Abramjee (@Abramjee) February 5, 2017 Share Tweet SHARE YOUR OPINION If you have an opinion you would like to share on this article, please to the Times LIVE iLIVE team. In the mean time, click here to view the Times LIVE iLIVE section.
